clinical_study.brief_title: Implementation of a Rapid Recovery Protocol in Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Clinical Trial Regarding the Implementation of a Rapid Recovery Protocol in Total Knee Arthroplasty in Rio Hortega University Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty will follow two different rehabilitation protocols. In one of them, they will start walking the day of surgery and discharged on a 48 hours basis. On the other one, start walking 3 days after surgery and discharged on a 96 hours basis. Outcomes will be satisfaction, pain, range of movement, incidence of DVT and overall complications.

detailed_description.textblock: Randomization will be performed concealed the day before surgery. Tranexamic acid will be used in both groups. Rapid recovery group will not be using a drain, whereas the standard protocol group will have one.

primary_outcome.measure: Pain: Morphine clorhydrate shots requested by the patient
primary_outcome.description: Number of shots requested and administered to the patient after surgery
Knee range of motion measured in degrees of flexion (0-180º and extension (0-180º)

primary_outcome.measure: Ultrasonography incidence of deep vein thrombosis
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of deep vein thrombosis measured by ultrasound

primary_outcome.measure: Overall score given by the patient to the knee replacement process
primary_outcome.description: Satisfaction with the protocol. Subjective measure by the patient from 0 (bad) to 10 (best) with the surgery process.

primary_outcome.measure: Oxford Knee Score pre op and post op
primary_outcome.description: Difference in Oxford Knee Scores postoperatively and preoperatively

arm_group.description: They will start walking the day of surgery. Levobupivacain 5mg/ml will be placed in the knee tissues. Tranexamic acid inside the knee. No drains.
They will start walking 3 days after surgery. Levobupivacain 5 mg/ml will be placed in the femoral nerve. Tranexamic acid inside the knee. A Redon drain will be used.

intervention.description: Patients will start walking on different timings. Patients on the rapid recovery protocol won't be using drains.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Knee osteoarthritis willing to undergo total knee arthroplasty
- Age 55-79
- Consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hipersensibility to any of the components used
- Epilepsy
- Pulmonary embolism
